poem:
**Exchange Rates**

A dance  
of numbers—  
the market  
reels as tariffs  
flare, a breath  
caught in bolts  
of silk and corn.  
  
Between nations  
a narrow thread,  
tension spun  
in red and blue—  
coins tossed  
into the void.  
A whisper  
on the wind:  
unfortunate.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "China retaliates with 84% tariffs on US goods as Trump trade war rattles markets – business live 2.11pm BST US Treasury secretary Scott Bessent has been sent out this morning to try to calm financial market nerves. He said he expects the bond market to calm down. He told Fox News that China’s retaliation was “unfortunate”, and would make them lose out. Bessent also said that China should not try to devalue its currency to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
